title: Plant-animal Communities: the changing balance of nature
subject_group: Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Plant ecology
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Plant conservation
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Plants - Adaptation
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Natural history
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Plant breeding
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Plants - Reproduction
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Plant population
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Environmental education
description: Uses various plant and animal examples to illustrate how such constantly changing factors as the rate of reproduction of a species, its available food supply, and the number of its natural enemies largely determine the survival of a species within a biome. Also shows some of the factors, including humans, which may upset the balance of a community.
